definition: foot/leg (of an animal or an object)/base (of an object)/CL:雙|双[shuang1],隻|只[zhi1]/classifier for kicks
board/plank/plate/shutter/table tennis bat/clappers (music)/CL:塊|块[kuai4]/accented beat in Chinese music/hard/stiff/to stop smiling or look serious

sentences.english: People toes are long, long but the soles of his feet.
sentences.chinese: 人的腳指頭再長，也長不過他的腳板。

sentences.english: Draw the simple design around the baseboard with a catchy color contrast.
sentences.chinese: 用醒目的顏色在踢腳板上畫好簡單的設計。

sentences.english: They were sitting on the dock, feet dangling in the water, Fishing poles in hand.
sentences.chinese: 他們坐在碼頭上，手裏拿着釣魚竿，腳板在水裏晃盪。

sentences.english: Is the sweat of envy's foot.
Sirius Black also known by his nickname Padfoot, was a pure-blood wizard.
sentences.chinese: 小天狼星布萊克綽號“大腳板”，是純血統的巫師。

sentences.english: But now we know that the bigger they are, the harder their feet.
sentences.chinese: 不過我們現在知道了，個頭越大，腳板越硬。

sentences.english: Finally, you can install the new tile and baseboard.
sentences.chinese: 最後，你可以設置新的瓦片和腳板。

sentences.english: Better yet, why not buy new baseboard tile too?
sentences.chinese: 會更美好，爲什麼不買新的腳板瓷磚嗎？

sentences.english: He leans on chair, double foot is stretched cozily , baseboard touchdown.
sentences.chinese: 他倚在椅上，雙腳舒適地張開，腳板着地。

sentences.english: Bending over the handlebars, I pedaled furiously, ringing my bell as I passed.
sentences.chinese: 俯在車把上，我瘋狂的蹬腳板，打着鈴超過了他們。

sentences.english: Dear Padfoot, I hope you're all right.
sentences.chinese: 親愛的大腳板，希望你一切安好。

sentences.english: Each chair comes with a removable full width footrest.
sentences.chinese: 每個座椅帶有一個可移動的寬度擱腳板。

definition: fitting one's feet (of shoes or socks)
